project.teaser: The 2021 EPBD recast highlights buildings' central role in the energy transition towards an integrated and renewable energy-based EU energy system. Smarter buildings will support the digitalisation and decarbonisation transition to the benefit of building occupants, owners and...
project.objective: The 2021 EPBD recast highlights buildings' central role in the energy transition towards an integrated and renewable energy-based EU energy system. Smarter buildings will support the digitalisation and decarbonisation transition to the benefit of building occupants, owners and the energy system. Improving energy performance and reducing energy demands are even more relevant in the context of the REPowerEU Plan to rapidly reduce dependence on Russian fossil fuels and accelerate the green transition. BuildON seeks to develop a highly replicable, generic solution to deliver intelligent building services, facilitate the integration of heterogeneous systems and technologies, and help Build the next generatiON of Smart buildings. The main objective of BuildON is to develop and demonstrate a Smart Transformer Toolbox at TRL8 to plan and achieve improved energy performance applicable to the broadest range of building typologies and smart readiness levels via a comprehensive demonstration campaign involving five representative real-life use cases. This toolbox will offer affordable, adaptative, close-to-market and easy-to-install SRI-aligned services to continuously Monitor, Assess, Predict and Optimise (MAPO services) a buildings performance. A unified representation of the building, exposed through a Universal Building API, will abstract all field-level communication complexity, allowing the energy devices homogeneous real-time monitoring and control. Moreover, the generation of (Maturity Level 3 and 4) Digital Twins will allow simulation and control of a building and its systems. User-friendly decision support and user empowerment tools for facility managers and occupants will be part of the toolbox to explore, understand and expand their buildings' smart capabilities. By providing a unified approach to interacting with buildings, the floor is offered to develop a building app store that significantly accelerates the Smart Transformation of existing and new buildings
project.title: Affordable and digital solutions to Build the next generatiON of smart EU buildings
project.keywords: user empowerment, Smart Readiness Indicator, smartness upgrade, IoT edge, cloud framework, Universal Building API, AI-based MAPO-services, smart Energy Management System, Digital Twins

article.title: Making buildings smarter, greener, and more user-friendly

result.title: Evaluation framework, audits and pilots’ preparation for data collection
result.description: This document will report on the progress of the demonstration campaign, including the definition of the evaluation framework, the initial pilot audits and the preparation (installation, commissioning of equipment).Success Criteria: The availability of the report including the evaluation framework definition, pilot’s audits and preparation. (T6.1, T6.2, T6.3)

result.title: A hybrid actor- and microservices-based platform for scalable smart building application deployment

details.authors: Flavia de Andrade Pereira, Kyriakos Katsigarakis, Nikos Kostis, Dimitrios Rovas

result.title: Plan for Communication and Dissemination of results
result.description: This report will include a description of the activities of the Communication and Dissemination plan and a first version of the KERs identified for exploitation.Success Criteria: The availability of the Communication and Dissemination plan, and first definition of KERs.(T8.1)

result.title: Human-smart assets interaction tools: analysis of user stories and requirements
result.description: This report will provide an elaboration of the users’ journey to define the solutions, test scenarios and their translation into user-tools technical requirements.Success Criteria: The user stories and requirements are clearly defined.(T2.1)

result.title: BuildON tools for smart users 1st technology release
result.description: This deliverable will provide the first development release of the user-empowerment STT supporting tools.Success Criteria: The availability of the first release of the BuildON tools for smart users.(T2.3, T2.4, T2.5)

result.title: IoT edge/cloud interoperability framework 1st technology release
result.description: This deliverable will provide the first development release of the IoT edge-cloud interoperability framework for data exchange and operation.Success Criteria: The availability of the first release of the edge-cloud interoperability framework.(T3.2, T3.3, T3.4, T3.5, T3.6)

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BuildON (Affordable and digital solutions to Build the next generatiON of smart EU buildings)
result.teaser: In a world increasingly focused on energy transition, the 2021 EPBD recast emphasised the pivotal role of buildings in achieving an integrated, renewable energy-based EU system. The urgency to digitalise and decarbonise, especially in light of the REPowerEU Plan, has never...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: BuildON Advisory Board
result.description: This report will provide details on the creation of the board and the definition of the action plan in collaboration with selected members.Success Criteria: The availability of the report and the creation of the Advisory Board.(T1.5)

result.title: Technical requirements and architecture design
result.description: This deliverable will report the reference edge-cloud architecture and high-level project requirements according to the defined usage scenarios.Success Criteria: The availability of the reference architecture specification.(T3.1)

result.title: BuildON Energy Management System and MAP-services Specification
result.description: This deliverable will provide a description of the Energy Management System and the specifications of the MAP-services, the interaction requirements, and the results from the lab-validation of the MAPO functionalities.Success Criteria: The availability of the EMS and MAP-services specification and first results from lab-validation.(T4.1, T4.2, T4.3, T4.4)

result.title: Archetype-driven approach and requirements for Smart Automation & Control Services and DTs for Building Operation
result.description: This document will include the description of the top-down approach followed to deliver adaptable building performance optimisation functionalities, on top on WP4 developments, including specifications and interaction requirements.Success Criteria: The availability of the report containing details about the top-down approach and interaction requirements for the orchestration of WP4 and WP5 components.(T5.1, T5.2, T5.3, T5.4)

result.title: Users’ engagement and participatory approach plan
result.description: This document will provide an elaboration of the main objectives of the engagement activities, the stakeholders involved, the co-design tools and a roadmap for its implementation.Success Criteria: The objectives of the engagement activities are clearly defined, and there is a plan and a roadmap considering the identified stakeholders, objectives and co-design tools. (T2.2)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
